page.title: 03Farming at Old Lodge
page.content: Mr.and Mrs.Hill live in a brick and sandstone farmhouse built about 1600. It has five bedrooms and used to be a hunting lodge on the Craven estate. A barn has roof timbers from an old sailing ship and the bricks in the house and barn were handmade. Five people work on the farm which has 384 acres in 17 fields. The fields have names like-Hogs Norton,Chestnuts, Rosey Butchers,Brook Meadow,Long Meadow and Cherry Orchard. The lansdcape is flat, growing wheat,barley,oats,oilseed rape and grass.Bees are kept to pollinate the rape.There used to be some sheep but the farm is too near houses where people keep dogs.There are 4 grain bins holding 90 tons each.There are two dogs,a horse and a pony. There will only be 16 fields when the planned Eastern Bypass is built soon.
